title: The Stake of Van Helsing
data:
| )   The Stake of Van Helsing   *(No tile)* |                                                                                                                                                               |
| ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                  | [wooden stake](/wiki/Wooden_stake "Wooden stake")                                                                                                             |
|                                            |                                                                                                                                                               |
| Damage vs. small                           | 1d6 **+12**                                                                                                                                                   |
| Damage vs. large                           | 1d6 **+12**                                                                                                                                                   |
| To-hit bonus                               | **+5**                                                                                                                                                        |
| Bonus versus                               | *(all)*                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                            |                                                                                                                                                               |
| Weapon skill                               | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                                                                                                               |
| Size                                       | one-handed                                                                                                                                                    |
| Affiliation                                | - [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful")
- [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer")
- [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifacts "Intelligent artifacts") |
|                                            |                                                                                                                                                               |
| When carried                               | [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")                                                                                                 |
| When wielded                               | *(none)*                                                                                                                                                      |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke")      | *(none)*                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                            |                                                                                                                                                               |
| Base price                                 | 5000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                                                            |
| Weight                                     | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                                                   |
| Material                                   | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")                                                                                                                                     |

**The Stake of Van Helsing** is the [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") in [Slash'EM](/wiki/Slash%27EM "Slash'EM"). It is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") for [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") purposes. Its base item type is a [wooden stake](/wiki/Wooden_stake "Wooden stake"), which uses the [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") skill. It has a flat +5 to-hit and +12 to-damage against all monsters, and provides [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") when carried. The name of the Stake is a reference to [Abraham Van Helsing](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abraham_Van_Helsing "wikipedia:Abraham Van Helsing").

As with any wooden stake, wielding it against a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") or [vampire bat](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat") gives a 10% chance of instantly killing the creature ("You plunge your stake into the heart of \<vampire>"). Otherwise, it still does 2 + d6 extra damage ("You drive your stake into \<vampire>").

## Strategy

This is fairly nice as quest artifacts go. Its damage bonus makes it strong enough to be a contender in SLASH'EM's endgame, while the periodic instakill is useful against annoyances such as [vampire mages](/wiki/Vampire_mage "Vampire mage") and [fire](/wiki/Fire_vampire "Fire vampire")/[star vampires](/wiki/Star_vampire "Star vampire"). Slotless magic resistance is also very useful, although as usual, if you are an undead slayer yourself you won't want to rely on this artifact for it. This is a decent candidate for a lawful artifact wish, especially given how the [Sceptre of Might](/wiki/Sceptre_of_Might "Sceptre of Might") has been nerfed in SLASH'EM.

Pacifists and other heavy pet-users will find this a very nice weapon for a pet [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar"): it is one of the few ways to give them extrinsic [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), and its damage bonus greatly augments Solars' already-impressive fighting capabilities.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Update to reflect THEM/Hack'EM"*

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

The Stake of Van Helsing

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)   The Stake of Van Helsing   (No tile)
Base item wooden stake
Damage vs. small 1d6 +12
Damage vs. large 1d6 +12
To-hit bonus +5
Bonus versus (all)
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Affiliation
  • lawful
  • Undead Slayer
  • intelligent
When carried

magic resistance

When wielded

(none)

When invoked

(none)

Base price 5000 zm
Weight 20
Material wood

The Stake of Van Helsing is the Undead Slayer quest artifact in Slash'EM. It is lawful for wishing purposes. Its base item type is a wooden stake, which uses the dagger skill. It has a flat +5 to-hit and +12 to-damage against all monsters, and provides magic resistance when carried. The name of the Stake is a reference to Abraham Van Helsing.

As with any wooden stake, wielding it against a vampire or vampire bat gives a 10% chance of instantly killing the creature ("You plunge your stake into the heart of <vampire>"). Otherwise, it still does 2 + d6 extra damage ("You drive your stake into <vampire>").

Strategy

This is fairly nice as quest artifacts go. Its damage bonus makes it strong enough to be a contender in SLASH'EM's endgame, while the periodic instakill is useful against annoyances such as vampire mages and fire/star vampires. Slotless magic resistance is also very useful, although as usual, if you are an undead slayer yourself you won't want to rely on this artifact for it. This is a decent candidate for a lawful artifact wish, especially given how the Sceptre of Might has been nerfed in SLASH'EM.

Pacifists and other heavy pet-users will find this a very nice weapon for a pet Solar: it is one of the few ways to give them extrinsic magic resistance, and its damage bonus greatly augments Solars' already-impressive fighting capabilities.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Update to reflect THEM/Hack'EM"
